title: Interpreting a Residual Plot: Speed and Average Gas Mileage
question_text:
A least squares regression analysis of average gas mileage versus speed (mph) produces the following residual plot:

Based on the residual plot, which of the following statement(s) must be TRUE?
I. The relationship between speed and average gas mileage is non-linear.
II. The average gas mileage decreased as speed increased from $35$ mph to $60$ mph.
III. The regression equation would overestimate the average miles per gallon the car gets when the speed is $10$ miles per hour.
solution:
It might be helpful to break down each one of the possible answers. First, recall that the horizontal line going through the residual plot at
0
is the least squares regression line.

Statement I is correct, as there is an apparent curve in the residual plot, indicating that the data is non-linear.

Statement II is incorrect. We cannot conclude from the residual plot if the average miles per gallon decreases from the speeds of
35
to
60
miles per hour. The residual plot does not tell us anything about the particular form of this non-linear shape.
